intro: Sericolea calophylla, commonly known as the silky-leaved sericolea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Sericolea calophylla is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
